title: Suggestions for where to buy good steel brushes.
content:
Hello,

I've been looking for good steel brushes in various shapes, but have found these to be quite hard to find(outside of the quite common speedball ones).  
So I was wondering if anyone would have a suggestion of where to find good ones, preferably shipping to Europe.

Thanks for any suggestions,

Paul-Kenji Cahier
author: Paul-Kenji Cahier

comments.content: Maybe you can ask Laurent Pflughaupt (le-callysteme.com) or Laurent Rebena (calligraphie.com).

Thanks for the info.  
(And by the way, if anyone knows about online shops that would do that, I would be fairly interested, even though I doubt these exist)

If you are looking for steel pen nibs, you might want to try John Neal Bookseller ( [www.johnnealbooks.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108172224/http:/www.johnnealbooks.com/ "www.johnnealbooks.com")).  
Besides books, they sell a wide variety of pens, brushes, nibs and other lettering and calligraphy tools. They are located in North Carolina and ship to Europe.

I've bought mine [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108172224/http:/web.comhem.se/blam/nibs/). Some were quite rare I remember him saying. So it's a shame I lost them. Not all info in English, but I assume he answers questions in English.
